Long Le's research focuses on active queue management (AQM) schemes like PI, REM, and ARED, showing their effectiveness with ECN under high network loads (≥90% capacity) but limited benefits without ECN.
Jay Aikat's research empirically shows that AQM schemes (PI, REM) with ECN improve web response times under high network loads (≥90%), while ARED performs poorly and AQM without ECN offers minimal benefit over drop-tail FIFO.
